document.docAuthor: Peng, Lang, Wang, Bei-Xin & Sun, Chang-Hai
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Psychomyia (Trichoptera: Psychomyiidae) from China, with re-descriptions of two species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of Psychomyia (Trichoptera: Psychomyiidae) from China, with re-descriptions of two species

bibRefCitation.author: Li, Y. - W. & Sun, C. - H. & Yang, L. - F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Li, Y. - W., Sun, C. - H. & Yang, L. - F. (1999) Chapter 14: Trichoptera. In: Huang, B-k. (Ed.), Fauna of Insects in Fujian Province of China. Vol. 1. Fu-jian Science and Technology Press, Fu-jian Province, Fu-jian, pp. 400 - 462.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: Length of each forewing 2.9–3.1 mm (n = 10). Specimens in alcohol with compound eyes black, legs brown, dorsal surfaces of thorax and abdomen dark brown, ventral surfaces pale cream. Forewings with forks II, III, IV, and V present, crossveins s , r, m-cu and m zigzagged; hind wings with forks II, III, and V present, R 1 atrophied, but discernable, R 2+3 ending at Sc ( Figs 7e, 7f ).

Materials examined: P.

Distribution: China (An-hui, Fu-jian, Hu-bei, Jiang-xi, Si-chuan, and Zhe-jiang).

Remarks: The species has tergum IX incompletely fused with preanal appendages and is discernible in both dorsal and ventral views. Furthermore, the species has relatively simple harpagones. Therefore, we treat it as a member of Schmid’s
P. pusilla
Species Group.
